yapm.common¶

This module creates all the common DAL objects that are needed by more than one segment or they are created only once but their container segments are created multiple times(template/aggregator applications)

yapm.common.create_aggregator_app(config_db, script_name, default_host, segment_name='')[source]¶

Create an aggregator application, either a rack level one or a top-level one and return it.

Arguments:

script_name – name of the aggregator script

default_host – where the aggregator app should run

segment name – name of segment where it runs(default “” for top level)

yapm.common.create_config_rules(config_db)[source]¶

Create the default publishing configuration and the efio configuration that are used by multiple segments/objects and add them to the database so they can be accessed when needed.

yapm.common.create_dcm_application(config_db, sfos_exist, standalone)[source]¶

Create a DCM application object using the arguments to tune its parameters and return a list containing the application.

Arguments:
sfos_exist – indicates whether there are SFOs
in the farm description (boolean)
standalone – indicates whether this is a DCM only
configuration (boolean)
yapm.common.create_hltmppu_template(config_db)[source]¶

Create the HLTMPPU template application and return it.

yapm.common.create_hltrc_application(config_db)[source]¶

Create an HLTRC application.

yapm.common.create_pu_apps(config_db)[source]¶

Create the HLTMPPU template and the HLTRC application and return a list containing them.

yapm.common.create_template_applications(config_db, dcm_only, hltpu_only, sfos_exist)[source]¶

Create the template applications for the HLT Segment(s) and return a list containing them to be used directly as input to the TemplateApplications relation of an HLT Segment. The arguments serve as directives to know which applications to create and for their internal parameter tuning.

Arguments:
dcm_only – indicates whether this is a DCM only
configuration (boolean)
hltpu_only – indicates whether this is
a PU only configuration (boolean)
sfos_exist – indicates whether there are SFOs
in the farm description (boolean)
Returns:
A list containing the template applications created based on the arguments given to the function.
